job_tasks.phrase: primarily responsible for design, code and unit test of new product features.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase directly describes traditional software development activities: designing, coding, and unit testing new features, which falls under the definition of Software Development & Integration.

job_tasks.phrase: required to work on product documentation
job_tasks.justification: Creating product documentation is a standard part of the software development lifecycle, supporting the integration and maintenance of features.
Building automation, in the context of software development, often refers to automating build processes or testing, which is a core aspect of Software Development & Integration.

job_tasks.phrase: work with QA teams on resolution of defects.
job_tasks.justification: Collaborating with QA teams to resolve defects is a standard software development practice, focusing on ensuring the quality and functionality of the product.

job_tasks.phrase: Review Requirement documentation and technical specifications
job_tasks.justification: Reviewing requirements and technical specifications is a foundational task in software development, ensuring that the planned features align with project goals.

job_tasks.phrase: Defect resolution, working with QA team on resolution of issues
job_tasks.justification: This reiterates the task of fixing bugs and issues identified by the QA team, which is a direct software development responsibility.

job_tasks.phrase: Provide input into planning and status tracking
job_tasks.justification: Contributing to planning and tracking is an integral part of the software development process, ensuring project progress and alignment.

soft_skills.phrase: You will be working within a global team
soft_skills.justification: Working within a global team implies a need for effective communication and collaboration across different locations and potentially cultures.

soft_skills.phrase: working with QA teams on resolution of defects.
soft_skills.justification: This explicitly mentions collaboration with another team (QA) to achieve a common goal (defect resolution).

soft_skills.phrase: Unlimited access to Udemy, Harvard Business Review, Safari O'Reilly, getAbstract, IBM AI Skills Academy
soft_skills.justification: The provision of extensive learning resources suggests an emphasis on continuous learning and professional development, aligning with the Learning & Adaptability category.

profile.rationale: The job advertisement focuses exclusively on traditional software development tasks such as design, coding, unit testing, documentation, build automation, and defect resolution. There is no mention of AI/ML models, generative AI, prompt engineering, RAG, or any AI-specific technologies or tasks. Therefore, the role is classified as a 'Software Engineer'.

confidence.reasoning: The job ad is very clear and specific about the responsibilities, which are all standard software engineering tasks. There is no ambiguity or mention of AI/ML, making the classification straightforward.
